resources.string: No pain level set. Entry not saved.
Tap a data point to display info or tap the + to add an entry
Helps you remember to log how you are feeling.

Made by:

Dan Bent
Sam Fleury
Emilio McFadzean

For COSC345

2018

Using Pain Tracker is easy!

To add an entry, just tap the plus button, fill out the information, and tap Save.

\Once you've made an entry, it'll be visible along with the rest of your records on the graph screen. You can tap on any entry in the graph to get a better look at its details. (Go to History under the hamburger menu in the top left to get a more in-depth look at your records.)

 You can also export your data to a PDF. Just find Export to PDF in the hamburger menu at the top left.

 If you run into any problems, or have other feedback, you can get in touch with us at paintrackerapphelp@gmail.com.

 Thanks for using Pain Tracker!
First, tap on the + icon to add an entry…
Fill in the information, then press SAVE
Once you’ve added an entry, it’ll appear on the graph on the main page. Scroll through your entries or tap on an entry to see a more detailed view.
Tap the hamburger icon in the top right to export your data as a PDF, adjust your settings, or to find out how you can help us improve the app!
